answers.answer: As far as I can tell you can't confuse one disease with the other. One has to do with elevated blood cells, the other elevated glucose [blood sugar] in the blood stream. Both require lifestyle changes or life threatening side effects may occur. If you have diabetes it must be controlled and managed to reduce the risk of heart failure." Is it possible to have Polycythemia and not have Type 2-Diabetes?"Yes, but the only way to know is by way of testing at a doctor's office.

question: I suffer from Polycythemia and must receive a phlebotomy  every 3 months.  In 2004, I was overweight and due to chronic back pain, led a very sedentary lifestyle and was unable to exercise.  Since then, I have lost 50 pounds and currently weigh in at 209. I am 6'0".  Back in 2004, I wound up in the ER with Walking Pneumonia,  Can the symptoms of Polycythemia be confused with the symptoms of Type 2 Diabetes.  Is it possible to have Polycythemia and not have Type 2-Diabetes?  Please advise.
title: NEVER GOT A SECOND OPINION
